message: Talked about repealing Obamacare today on Varney & Co. - check it out: http://video.foxbusiness.com/v/5270329752001/?#sp=news-clips

So many things we were told about Obamacare when it was passed turned out to be false. I believe that healthcare will be better and less expensive when Obamacare is gone. That's what we need to focus on. https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/videos/2017-01-04/rep-jordan-obamacare-repeal-to-happen-in-the-next-month

Joined MSNBC to discuss repealing Obamacare yesterday. Healthcare in the U.S. will be better and less expensive when Obamacare is gone. Then we should put in place a less Washington-focused and more family- and market-focused model to actually improve healthcare in America.

We need to do what the American people sent us here to do. Healthcare will be better and more affordable when Obamacare is gone. Time to repeal it and replace it with something that works. Check out my interview from today with Neil Cavuto on Fox Business below.

Wanted to remind everyone about the photo competition my office is hosting:  Residents of the Fourth District can submit photographs for consideration to my Lima (3121 West Elm Plaza) and Norwalk (13 B Main Street) offices. Residents should deliver or mail their original photos to one of those district offices.  Contest guidelines:   - Submit original photos of recognizable landmarks, buildings, or people from the Fourth District of Ohio. - Include identification with the photo that depicts the photographer’s full name, address, email address and phone number, as well as a title for the photograph. - Deliver the original photo size 8x10 or larger to the Lima (3121 West Elm Plaza) or Norwalk (13 B East Main Street) district offices by close of business on Monday, January 16.  - Please note submitted photos will not be returned.  Thanks for participating!
Thank-you to the men and women who serve and protect us daily in Ohio's Fourth District and across the country.
NA

Wrote an oped with my colleague Mark Meadows, chairman of the House Freedom Caucus, for The Hill about the work Congress must now do to keep our promises to the American people. Now is the time to act.

My friend Congressman Mike Pompeo is incredibly qualified to serve as CIA director. Talked to CNN's Wolf Blitzer this morning about his confirmation hearing (happening now). Check it out here: https://youtu.be/A1MFtA6KHNY
Join me and Congressman Warren Davidson for a Facebook Live discussion about Obamacare!

This is step one in the process to repeal Obamacare, a law that has driven up prices and hurt care. There are several steps to come but the goal is very clear: repeal it all – every regulation, every tax, every mandate – and do it this Congress. All the talk of a three to four year phase out is not what we told the voters we would do. I will work to repeal it all as fast as we can.

The deadline for the Fourth District photo competition has been extended to February 1. Hope you will participate!  Residents of the Fourth District can submit photographs for consideration to my Lima (3121 West Elm Plaza) and Norwalk (13 B Main Street) offices. Residents should deliver or mail their original photos to one of those district offices. Contest guidelines: - Submit original photos of recognizable landmarks, buildings, or people from the Fourth District of Ohio. - Include identification with the photo that depicts the photographer’s full name, address, email address and phone number, as well as a title for the photograph. - Deliver the original photo size 8x10 or larger to the Lima (3121 West Elm Plaza) or Norwalk (13 B East Main Street) district offices by close of business on Wednesday, February 1.  - Please note submitted photos will not be returned.

It was an honor to attend the inauguration and swearing-in of President Donald Trump. Under President Trump’s leadership, I look forward to fighting for ordinary Americans who have been forgotten by Washington’s elites. It’s time to do what we promised folks we would do when they elected us to serve them. No more excuses. The time has come to implement a bold, conservative agenda that puts everyday Americans first.

I applaud President Trump’s decision to reinstate the Mexico City Policy banning foreign non-governmental organizations that receive U.S. aid from promoting and performing abortions. The American people do not want taxpayer dollars to pay for the taking of innocent life. This is a fitting way to begin the week of the March for Life.

Today, the U.S. House of Representatives passed the No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion and Abortion Insurance Full Disclosure Act. This bill is a nationally popular piece of legislation that ensures no taxpayer dollars are used to pay for the taking of innocent life. The vast majority of Americans support this common-sense policy, and it’s time for Congress to recognize that fact by sending this bill to President Trump’s desk.

President Trump’s actions today are the first step toward securing our country from illegal immigration. These actions will help us fight everything from human trafficking to the flow of illegal drugs into the U.S., and will also benefit the millions of people around the world who are seeking to legally become U.S. residents and citizens, to assimilate, and to participate in the American dream.

For any Ohioans attending the March for Life in Washington, D.C. today, my office and Senator Rob Portman's office are co-hosting a reception in Capitol Visitor Center Room 217 (Congressional Meeting Room South) following the march. Come by to meet with our staff over some refreshments before heading home!

As tens of thousands of pro-life Americans and millions more nation-wide celebrate the sanctity of life today, I call on Republican leadership to keep their commitment to the American people and defund Planned Parenthood through reconciliation. We are a majority pro-life nation. We need to recognize that by advancing legislation that protects the most vulnerable among us.

Only two days left in the Fourth District photo competition. Get your pictures in!  Residents of the Fourth District can submit photographs for consideration to my Lima (3121 West Elm Plaza) and Norwalk (13 B Main Street) offices. Residents should deliver or mail their original photos to one of those district offices. Contest guidelines: - Submit original photos of recognizable landmarks, buildings, or people from the Fourth District of Ohio. - Include identification with the photo that depicts the photographer’s full name, address, email address and phone number, as well as a title for the photograph. - Deliver the original photo size 8x10 or larger to the Lima (3121 West Elm Plaza) or Norwalk (13 B East Main Street) district offices by close of business on Wednesday, February 1.  - Please note submitted photos will not be returned.

I talked to Bob Frantz from Cleveland's 1420 AM The Answer today about President Trump's executive order on refugees. Check it out: https://soundcloud.com/rep-jim-jordan/1302017-interview-with-bob-franz-the-answer
First Conversations with Conservatives of 2017. Join us now!

Neil Gorsuch is a great choice. He's done an outstanding job on the 10th Circuit and will do the same on the Supreme Court. His respect for the sanctity of life, for religious liberty and the Constitution is exactly what we need in a justice for the seat that was held by Antonin Scalia.
Enjoyed a spirited discussion this morning with Chris Cuomo on CNN New Day about President Trump's executive order on immigration and refugees. Check it out: https://youtu.be/1JmfZBZTEqg
Joined Fox News America's News Headquarters this afternoon to discuss repealing Obamacare. Check it out: http://video.foxnews.com/v/5314712331001
Thanks to The Daily Signal for hosting Mark Meadows and me for a #FacebookLive discussion about repealing and replacing #Obamacare.
NA

Only in government would "official time" actually mean time spent doing union-related activities instead of serving veterans and the American people. Check it out: https://oversight.house.gov/hearing/use-official-time-union-activities-department-veterans-affairs/

Check out the great efforts of the folks at MarionMade!, celebrating a great community in the 4th District. I applaud the way Marion residents are working together to make their city a better place and to celebrate locally owned businesses and locally made products.
In case you missed it: I joined ABC News This Week with George Stephanopoulos yesterday to discuss repealing and replacing Obamacare. Check it out: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2fxw_hFem1E
Enjoyed discussing congressional efforts to repeal and replace Obamacare on Fox and Friends this morning - check it out below:

Had a great discussion on Morning Joe on MSNBC this morning about #Obamacare repeal and President Trump's first speech to a joint session of Congress tonight. Here's the second part, about tonight's speech. To watch the first part about Obamacare repeal, click here: https://youtu.be/N9n-bmEwKLc

We have a fundamental task: Do what the voters of this great country sent us here to do. President Trump understands that, and it’s time for all of us to get to work.  I'll be discussing the speech tonight with Sean Hannity at 11:35 p.m. on Fox News.
Remembering the Bluffton University community today.

Today I'm introducing legislation that cleanly repeals Obamacare, like we did 15 months ago and sent to President Obama's desk. It's time for Republicans to do what we told you the American people we would do.

Republicans need to just simply do what we told you we were going to do when you sent us here. We need to repeal Obamacare. The current Republican plan keeps way too much of the Obamacare structure in place.
NA
Joined Fox News Sunday with Chris Wallace this morning to discuss repealing and replacing Obamacare. Check out the video.
Joined the team at Fox and Friends this morning to discuss repealing Obamacare, in light of the CBO score on the current House leadership plan to replace it. Check it out.
The current House Obamacare replacement plan doesn't repeal Obamacare, it doesn't bring down the cost of premiums and it doesn't unite Republicans. I'm opposed to the plan in its current form.
Latest on efforts to repeal and replace Obamacare...

Obamacare is a disaster, and repealing it remains one of my top priorities. It's why I introduced a clean repeal bill and have been pushing for a vote. The AHCA did not have the support it needed, neither in Congress nor among the American people. Now, House Republicans owe it to our constituents to immediately get back to the drawing board and bring forward a bolder effort to replace the failing Obamacare with a plan to reduce costs by increasing choice and competition. I look forward to working with my Republican colleagues to accomplish this goal.

From this morning with Morning Joe: There were political problems with the American Health Care Act, there were policy problems and there were process problems. And typically good process will lead to better policy which I think leads to better politics. The mistake on this past bill was we didn’t do what the American people sent us here to do. Because it wasn’t full repeal. So when it comes to tax reform, when it comes to border security, when it comes to the other big issues we’ve talked about accomplishing and that we promised the voters we would, let’s do what we said. If we do that I think we will be fine.

Let’s do what the president said. Let’s get a deal put together, but one that accomplishes what we were sent here to accomplish. We want to put together a plan that actually repeals Obamacare and that actually lowers premiums.
Enjoyed talking about the House Freedom Caucus with POLITICO Playbook co-authors Anna Palmer and Jake Sherman, and my colleagues Mark Meadows and Justin Amash today - video below.
Congratulations to Lehman Catholic High School senior Seth Brown for winning this year's 4th District congressional art competition!

Since President Trump took office, I have been working relentlessly on our shared goal of repealing Obamacare and replacing it with a better, more affordable plan. Our efforts in the House Freedom Caucus to hold the line and improve the American Health Care Act have paid off. While I remain committed to replacing Obamacare entirely, I can support this new version of the bill moving forward.  It is our best chance to pass a bill through the House that will actually reduce the cost of health insurance for everyday Americans. I look forward to working with the Senate to further improve this bill, and deliver on the promise that Republicans and the president made to the American people.  Some more info: http://dailysignal.com/2017/04/26/with-support-from-conservatives-house-republicans-move-closer-to-obamacare-repeal-deal/

The American people sent President Trump to the White House to keep his promises and change Washington. After his first 100 days, it’s clear that he intends to keep his promises. He nominated a committed constitutionalist, Neil Gorsuch, to the Supreme Court. He repealed unnecessary regulations on energy production and has begun to loosen Obamacare’s regulatory stranglehold. His cabinet nominees, including some of my former colleagues, have been top-notch.   There’s more work to do. We need to repeal Obamacare and replace it with a patient-centered plan that will reduce the cost of premiums for everyday Americans. We need to secure our borders, and we need to reform our tax code to encourage economic growth. I’m confident that with the start we’ve had so far we will do each of these things and keep our promises to the American people.

The legislation that passed the House today is better because of the intense involvement of conservatives over the past few weeks. While it is not full repeal, it is a crucial first step to fulfilling that promise to repeal and replace Obamacare. I look forward to continuing to work with my colleagues in Congress to make this legislation better and to fulfill our promise to the American people.

We need to get to the bottom of the allegations against President Trump. I support Chairman Chaffetz’s request for documents related to President Trump’s interactions with former FBI Director Comey. But Congress cannot allow this to keep us from doing what we were sent here to do. We need to fully repeal Obamacare, and we need to reform the tax code so Americans can keep more of their hard-earned money.

I'm keeping an open mind about the Department of Justice appointment of Robert Mueller as special counsel, but I was disappointed in my one interaction with him a few years ago. Spoke about that and more last night with Wolf Blitzer. Take a look.

While we don't have all the details, our thoughts and prayers are with the concert attendees in Manchester, and with the officials investigating this terrible incident.  http://www.cnn.com/2017/05/22/europe/manchester-arena-incident/index.html

Finally we have a president who presents a pathway to a balanced budget. President Trump's budget provides much-needed increases in spending for our military while also reforming our welfare system by incentivizing work for able-bodied adults. The ball is now in the House’s court to write a budget that is fiscally responsible and reflects the priorities of American families and taxpayers, which President Trump has recognized.
The new CBO score for the American Health Care Act confirms that because conservatives engaged, premiums will come down.
Check out my op-ed with United States Senator Mike Lee in today's Washington Examiner.

Annually the federal government pays $144 billion in improper payments. Federal law requires agencies to report programs that are susceptible to significant improper payments. James Runcie, former Chief Operating Officer of the Federal Student Aid office, failed to comply with this law, and then resigned instead of testifying before Congress. He received over $400,000 in bonuses over the past six years, despite his failure to comply with the law. This is exactly what American taxpayers hate about the federal government. Full hearing: https://oversight.house.gov/hearing/improper-payments-federal-government-student-aid/

Today we remember the debt we can never repay, owed to those who gave everything in the line of duty. From the bottom of our hearts, thank-you to the members of the U.S. military who died in service of our country.

The Paris accord is a treaty that should have had a vote in the Senate. President Trump did the right thing by withdrawing us from an agreement that was not properly ratified. The Paris treaty would hurt American companies and American workers by depressing economic output, keep companies from creating jobs and drive millions more out of the country. To top it off, the Paris treaty would ultimately have little effect on our environment. At a time when American companies are already successfully reducing their carbon emissions, we don’t need another government regulation restricting our economy’s ability to grow.
On this day 73 years ago, soldiers of the Greatest Generation fought for freedom on the beaches of Normandy. Forever grateful for the sacrifices they made on D-Day.
If we aren't making the progress we need to by August, Congress should forego the traditional August recess. We need to repeal Obamacare and reform the tax code.

Republicans have a once in a generation opportunity to pass real tax reform, resulting in a simpler, flatter, and fairer tax code for everyone. But the border adjustment tax stands in the way. It's time that Congress dismiss the idea of the border adjustment tax and move forward with real reform.

Today’s shooting was tragic, and I’m just grateful that my colleague Congressman Steve Scalise and the others who were injured will be okay. The Capitol Police were heroes today for their actions in the line of duty.

A quick reminder this Flag Day as we honor the stars and stripes: My office can facilitate purchasing flags that have been flown over the U.S. Capitol, on specific days and for special occasions. Click here for more information: https://flagorder.house.gov/FlagOrder.aspx?ssdd=oh04

The Castro regime has a long record of human rights abuses against the people of Cuba and we cannot tolerate such actions. President Trump today stood up for the victims of the Castro brothers and restored America’s place as a supporter of a free Cuba. America is the long-time partner of the Cuban people, and President Trump’s actions today put the Castros on notice that their oppressive actions do not have our support.

Had a good conversation on CNBC Squawk Box this morning about tax reform. We need to lower rates for Americans, and we shouldn't put a whole new border adjustment tax burden on the economy. Then let's cut some spending so we can start addressing our $20 trillion debt. https://youtu.be/otXe4ZweCmg

In case you missed it, my good friend Mark Meadows and I joined Sean Hannity on Fox News last night to talk about implementing President Donald J. Trump's agenda. If that means we need to cancel the congressional August recess to do so, then let's do it!

Yesterday I called for the Judiciary Committee to hold hearings about former FBI Director James Comey's testimony that former AG Loretta Lynch directed him to downplay the reopened Clinton email investigation last fall. Remember, the Justice Department wouldn't appoint a special counsel for the IRS targeting scandal or the Clinton email scandal. But as soon as James Comey's reputation is on the line, they appointed one. This is incredible, and why we need to hold hearings.

"This is the type of unequal justice that Americans despise. No special counsel in the IRS targeting investigation. No special counsel for the Clinton email investigation. But if it’s about protecting Comey’s reputation and hurting President Trump, then of course there has to be a special counsel." Check out my joint Fox News op-ed with Congressman Mark Meadows and Congressman Jody Hice.
Joined Fox Business this morning to talk about tax reform and healthcare - check it out below.
The Senate needs to act. Obamacare is falling apart in front of us. We can't afford to wait any longer.
Happy Independence Day, folks!

Yesterday I visited Diamond Manufacturing and met with a young man named Anthony Cook Jr. who is a prime example of how a partnership between personal determination, private enterprise and government reform can help individuals achieve the American Dream. Anthony graduated from Perry High School in May, and Ohio Means Jobs and Diamond Manufacturing in Bluffton worked together to help Anthony gain the skills and certification he needed to build a career. Anthony has a tough family life, and is the caretaker of his two younger brothers. Through the help of his high school and Ohio’s job training and placement program, hardship hasn’t stopped Anthony. He is taking control of his own future. I am so proud of him.  Read more about his story here: http://limaohio.com/news/251005/jordan-welfare-reform-workforce-development-in-bluffton

Held a press conference today with my fellow House Freedom Caucus members to call for the House to stay in session through August in order to get done what the American people sent us here to do: repeal Obamacare, pass tax reform, secure our borders and so much more.
Looking forward to hearing these two talk about free speech issues on college campuses.

It's time for a clean repeal of Obamacare. This is what we told the American people we were going to do. This is what we passed last Congress. So let's put the same thing on President Trump's desk that we put on then-President Obama's desk. It will be a different outcome this time: President Trump will sign it. Then, during the wind-down period, Congress can come together and work on a replacement to actually deal with key issues that will bring down premiums for middle-class families.
It's time for clean repeal of Obamacare. We made a promise and we need to keep it. My good friend Mark Meadows and I discussed this with Sean Hannity last night on Fox News.
We made a promise. It's time to keep it.

Here's the truth about the Congressional Budget Office's healthcare projections: "CBO economists are trained to apply Keynesian economic formulas to predict future consumer behavior, but their projections don't often account for common-sense realities..." Check out my op-ed with Mark Meadows in the Washington Examiner on the subject.
Looking forward to joining my office neighbor Rep. Paul Gosar for Facebook Live tomorrow night at 8:30 p.m. Eastern!
Joining my good friend and neighbor Rep. Paul Gosar on Facebook Live now:

Always enjoy joining the Fox & Friends team. Talked healthcare, and an effort by myself and a few colleagues to start an investigation of James Comey and Loretta Lynch for their handling of the Clinton investigation. Check it out: http://video.foxnews.com/v/5521908988001/?#sp=show-clips

The attorney general of the United States instructed the FBI director of the United States to tell the American people something that was not accurate. James Comey testified to this fact under oath. Even Senator Dianne Feinstein said this should be investigated. I'm supporting the efforts of my colleague Congressman Matt Gaetz to have a special counsel investigate this important issue.

Tune in tomorrow at 9 a.m. for a hearing with Ben Shapiro, Adam Carolla and others talking about attacks on the First Amendment on college and university campuses around the country: https://oversight.house.gov/hearing/challenges-freedom-speech-college-campuses/
Happening now - Challenges to Freedom of Speech on College Campuses: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BOoHS6C-AUY
My opening remarks from today's House Oversight Committee hearing about free speech issues on college campuses.

This weekend's unconscionable violence was an evil act of terror against Americans and American ideals. Racism and anti-Semitism have no place in our society. Those responsible for the violence must be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law for their terrible actions.  Discussed this issue with Bob Frantz on AM 1420 this morning.

Today President Trump will visit the U.S./Mexico border and reaffirm his commitment to securing our border. Under President Trump, the number of people trying to enter the U.S. illegally has dropped significantly. But we need to do more. I agree with the president that secure borders are a vital part of our national security. For the good of our country, Congress should include border wall funding in government funding legislation this fall. It’s what we ran on – we need to fulfill that promise.

Deadlines influence behavior. We have a six-month time frame to force a debate in Congress about how to deal with DACA, immigration, visa overstays, and the border security wall. That is how it’s supposed to work. President Trump recognized that a federal judge would rule the DACA program unconstitutional. He wanted a responsible timeline for winding things down, and he put the issue rightly back in the hands of Congress. Now we have time to have this debate, and I’m hoping the end result will be something consistent with what we told you all when you sent us here.

I don't think President Trump's debt limit deal with Democrats was a good one, but he didn't have many choices. Republicans in Congress failed to provide him with good alternatives. We didn't prepare. We didn't stay here in August and put together a debt ceiling plan that addressed our $20 trillion debt. Instead, we took the longest non-election year break in over a decade, and when we came back we had no plan.

Joined Chris Wallace on Fox News Sunday this morning to discuss President Trump's debt limit deal with Democrats and Republican plans for tax reform. It's time we do what we said and keep our promises. https://jordan.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398141

September 11, 2001 was a definitive date in our nation’s history. Since then, thousands of Americans and Ohioans have paid the ultimate price fighting overseas to make sure a similar tragedy never happens again. It was an honor to attend the dedication ceremony for the Gibsonburg 9/11 memorial last year and it was a privilege to visit again today. The memorial is a powerful reminder that we must remain vigilant and never forget that day.
Joined the Morning Joe panel today to discuss a Wall Street Journal editorial that criticized my friend Mark Meadows, and also last week's debt ceiling vote.

Today The Wall Street Journal published an op-ed I co-wrote with Mark Meadows about why we need to see the Republican tax reform plan before voting for a budget with reconciliation instructions. Check it out: https://www.wsj.com/articles/give-us-real-tax-reform-not-a-pigin-a-poke-1505862072  The House Freedom Caucus will gladly start the process if we are confident the tax plan will actually cut taxes for families, simplify the code and create jobs. We will gladly pass the budget when basic questions are answered.  The biggest question: Why the secrecy? Congress has been in session almost nine months. Why the reluctance to show the American people the plan?
Conversations with Conservatives is happening now - watch: https://www.facebook.com/conversationswithconservatives/

The House Freedom Caucus wanted to see a framework on what tax reform would look like before agreeing to start the reconciliation process. The details we've seen so far are very encouraging, and we're looking forward to working with Republicans in the House to reform the tax code and make sure you get to keep more of your hard-earned money.

It’s time to do what the American people sent us here to do: reform the tax code so everyday Americans can keep more of their hard-earned money. Today’s budget vote opens the door to tax reform, and I look forward to working with my colleagues to lower rates, simplify the tax code and encourage economic growth. It’s time to keep our promise.
Great op-ed by Congressman Andy Biggs on why we need to build the wall and secure the border.
Tune in to this month's Conversations with Conservatives, live now.

An investigation is exactly what needs to happen. Americans despise double standards. They hate when there is one set of rules for regular Americans but a different set for the politically connected like James Comey, Loretta Lynch and Secretary Clinton. I applaud Congressman Trey Gowdy and Congressman Bob Goodlatte for their focus on getting the truth and supporting the principle of equal treatment under the law.
Discussed the new congressional probes into Uranium One and the Department of Justice's actions during the 2016 elections on America's Newsroom today. Check it out below.

IRS Commissioner John Koskinen was appointed to the IRS to clean it up after Lois Lerner used her position to target conservatives. But instead, under his watch, subpoenaed documents were destroyed and bad employees were rehired. He should have been fired or impeached a long time ago. Thankfully his time as head of the IRS is coming to an end, and I look forward to new leadership for this scandal-plagued entity.

Ambassador Christopher Stevens, Glen Doherty, Sean Smith, and Tyrone Woods are American heroes for their service to and sacrifice for our country. President Trump’s announcement that Mustafa al-Imam has been captured is welcome news for all of us who sought to answer the questions about what happened in Benghazi. I look forward to justice being served.
Discussed yesterday's tragic terror attack in New York City, and the Mueller indictments, with Alisyn Camerota on CNN New Day this morning. Check it out below.

Why don't we have a special counsel looking into Hillary Clinton, James Comey, and the FusionGPS dossier? I'm looking for answers--because that's what the American people deserve.   WATCH the interview here.

The American people deserve answers to the mounting questions about Mueller, Clinton, and the Fusion GPS dossier.   It's time for Attorney General Jeff Sessions to name a special counsel and get the job done.

Why did the now infamous and unsubstantiated dossier--paid for by the Clinton campaign and DNC--become an intelligence document? Did the FBI take that dossier to court for a warrant to spy on American citizens associated with President Trump's campaign?   The American people deserve answers. So, why won’t Attorney General Sessions answer these questions or appoint a special counsel?
The American people work hard. Today, we passed the first step in tax reform so Americans can start keeping more of their own money.
It's simple. In Congress, the American people sent us to Washington to do a job. We need to do what we said we were going to do.
The House did what we told the American people we would do—we’ve funded the troops and held the line on non-defense spending. The Senate needs to do the same. #YourMoveMitch
The US embassy should be in Jerusalem. It is only right to acknowledge the capitol of Israel. Many have promised to do this, but today the President delivered. Thank you, Mr. President.

If this happened--government working with one campaign to dress up a fake news report as intelligence, then taking it to a FISA court for a warrant to spy on the other political campaign--that's as wrong as it gets. And it shouldn't happen in America.

The American people deserve to know that their government is not working with one campaign to dress up a fake news report as intelligence, and then use it to get a warrant to spy on the other political campaign. I'll keep asking questions until Congress and the American people get all the facts.

Everyday something new seems to come out reinforcing the belief that the government worked with one political party to go after the other political party. That is not supposed to happen in this great country. The American people deserve answers and the truth.
Congratulations to Anna native Joseph Nartker on being named Trooper of the Year. Thank you for your service and for protecting our community.
